2_13GyWy7pXEtCorqUBAv7ZPjyzNfwMA6Hh2.body:
There is certain types of computational problems that are easy to be run in parallel (Seti@home) and there are those that are not. Running a MMO game is probably more of the latter one, where the challenge is to reply to a player in real time and keep a "massive" amount of users in a consistent state, rather than the complexity of the computation itself. 
I certainly like the idea of decentralized computation, though I might think it will emerge in other forms first.
